intro: Diplostephium leiocladum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various insects.
